For the log view error, it looks like applyFonts is being called before
initializeFonts.

xox, Wassim

It looks as if Wassim has taken over Nick Edgar's computer over there :)

As for the LogView error, fixed and released to head.

As for the PointSelectionPage, I was unable to reproduce it.  :(  Would you be
able to give me any reproduce steps for this one?
Wassim is no longer possessing my computer <g>.

I might be off but I can't seem to find the I200403181300 build.  The only ones
I see in download.eclipse.org are 20040318-0800/1131 :(  And sadly, build
0318-1131 doesn't have the new PointSelectionPage.

Is there a hidden build from yesterday?

Cherie, use your imagination :-)

Two problems:
1. The fonts are being applied before being initialized.  See comment #1.
2. NPE in the extension wizard (i.e. top of the stack).  Make sure we don't 
return null;

Hi Wassim, I've been looking at the code and I should never be returning null.

The good (somewhat) news is that I was able to reproduce this bug.  It occurs
when the contributing id is null.  However, I hardcoded those in nicely so it
should never be null. :(  Hence, what I'm suspecting for a moment is that the
new integration build does not have the updated plugin.xml with contributingId's.

The last integration build I have is I0318-1131 which doesn't have the updated
wizard so it's hard to check with your build. :(

Would you be able to check that the plugin.xml with contributingId's is in your
I-build or not?  If it is, I'm going to have to look again at where this null is
coming from.

i.e. 
      <wizard
            contributingId="org.eclipse.ui.actionSets"
            name="%newExtension.templates.hello.name"
            template="true"
            icon="icons/ctool16/newex_wiz.gif"
            category="templates"
            class="org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.wizards.templates.HelloWorldTemplate"
            id="org.eclipse.pde.ui.newExtension.hello">
         <description>
            %newExtension.templates.hello.desc
         </description>
      </wizard>


xox,
Cherie.
I was running the I20040318-1131 build.  Sorry for the confusion.
Fixed and released to head.  Please verify :)
